intro: Exostema microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited exostema, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, capsule-like fruits and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical plant morphology and adaptation.
